comment_text: So what kind of power does it use ? 220v?

Unfortunately for the majority of viewers, the acronym DMX (Digital Multiplex), which was used with no explanation, may fly right over your head. DMX 512 is the standard cable/signal used in many type of automated lighting, LED, Moving Heads, smoke/fog machines Etc.. This is also the same signal that is used by people that make those really cool Christmas light setups on their house that flash to music.
How named this lens , that catch 60 led beams to a single beam? Please reply somebody
How It's Made is sometimes really vague, so I was betting that they were not going to mention DMX.  Well, they proved me wrong.

While it's getting better everyday, we're still not to the point where the LED fixtures are as good as the traditional HPL lamps.  But I have to give ETC a lot of credit, they've done a lot in recent years to make it easier to re-use older Source Four bodies and swap the lamp out for LEDs.  That's going to make LED adoption much easier and happen a lot faster than it would if they just waited for people to invest in all LED specials.
